trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service.
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow and run the workflow on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow and run the workflow on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To learn about the Oozie coordinator, see [Use time-based Hadoop Oozie Coordinator with HDInsight][hdinsight-oozie-coordinator-time].
trans-unit.target: To learn about the Oozie coordinator, see [Use time-based Hadoop Oozie Coordinator with HDInsight][hdinsight-oozie-coordinator-time].

trans-unit.source: To learn Azure Data Factory, see [Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory][azure-data-factory-pig-hive].
trans-unit.target: To learn Azure Data Factory, see [Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory][azure-data-factory-pig-hive].

trans-unit.source: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts.

trans-unit.source: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this tutorial contains two actions:
trans-unit.target: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this tutorial contains two actions:

trans-unit.source: ![Workflow diagram][img-workflow-diagram]
trans-unit.target: ![Workflow diagram][img-workflow-diagram]

trans-unit.source: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j file.
trans-unit.target: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j file.

trans-unit.source: Each log4j file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field that shows the type and the severity, for example:
trans-unit.target: Each log4j file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field that shows the type and the severity, for example:

trans-unit.source: The Hive script output is similar to:
trans-unit.target: The Hive script output is similar to:

trans-unit.source: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].

trans-unit.source: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL output to a table in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL output to a table in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Sqoop, see [Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Sqoop, see [Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run as an administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.
trans-unit.target: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run as an administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].

trans-unit.source: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script
trans-unit.target: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script

trans-unit.source: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).
trans-unit.target: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).

trans-unit.source: The default workflow file name is *workflow.xml*.
trans-unit.target: The default workflow file name is *workflow.xml*.

trans-unit.source: The following is the workflow file you will use in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The following is the workflow file you will use in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: There are two actions defined in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: There are two actions defined in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The start-to action is *RunHiveScript*.
trans-unit.target: The start-to action is *RunHiveScript*.

trans-unit.source: If the action runs successfully, the next action is *RunSqoopExport*.
trans-unit.target: If the action runs successfully, the next action is *RunSqoopExport*.

trans-unit.source: The RunHiveScript has several variables.
trans-unit.target: The RunHiveScript has several variables.

trans-unit.source: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Workflow variables
trans-unit.target: Workflow variables

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${jobTracker}
trans-unit.target: ${jobTracker}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop job tracker.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop job tracker.

trans-unit.source: Use
trans-unit.target: Use

trans-unit.source: jobtrackerhost:9010
trans-unit.target: jobtrackerhost:9010

trans-unit.source: in HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1.
trans-unit.target: in HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1.

trans-unit.source: ${nameNode}
trans-unit.target: ${nameNode}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop name node.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop name node.

trans-unit.source: Use the default file system address, for example,
trans-unit.target: Use the default file system address, for example,

trans-unit.source: wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: ${queueName}
trans-unit.target: ${queueName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to.

trans-unit.source: Use the
trans-unit.target: Use the

trans-unit.source: default
trans-unit.target: default

trans-unit.source: Hive action variable
trans-unit.target: Hive action variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the source directory for the Hive Create Table command.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the source directory for the Hive Create Table command.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the output folder for the INSERT OVERWRITE statement.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the output folder for the INSERT OVERWRITE statement.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the Hive table that references the log4j data files.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the Hive table that references the log4j data files.

trans-unit.source: Sqoop action variable
trans-unit.target: Sqoop action variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${sqlDatabaseConnectionString}
trans-unit.target: ${sqlDatabaseConnectionString}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure SQL database connection string.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure SQL database connection string.

trans-unit.source: ${sqlDatabaseTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${sqlDatabaseTableName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure SQL database table where the data will be exported to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure SQL database table where the data will be exported to.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the output folder for the Hive INSERT OVERWRITE statement.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the output folder for the Hive INSERT OVERWRITE statement.

trans-unit.source: This is the same folder for the Sqoop export (export-dir).
trans-unit.target: This is the same folder for the Sqoop export (export-dir).

trans-unit.source: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight version 2.1).

trans-unit.source: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:
trans-unit.target: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:

trans-unit.source: **The DROP TABLE statement** deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.
trans-unit.target: **The DROP TABLE statement** deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.

trans-unit.source: **The CREATE TABLE statement** creates a log4j Hive external table that points to the location of the log4j log file.
trans-unit.target: **The CREATE TABLE statement** creates a log4j Hive external table that points to the location of the log4j log file.

trans-unit.source: The field delimiter is ",".
trans-unit.target: The field delimiter is ",".

trans-unit.source: The default line delimiter is "\n".
trans-unit.target: The default line delimiter is "\n".

trans-unit.source: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location if you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.
trans-unit.target: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location if you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.

trans-unit.source: **The INSERT OVERWRITE statement** counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and saves the output to a blob in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: **The INSERT OVERWRITE statement** counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and saves the output to a blob in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: There are three variables used in the script:
trans-unit.target: There are three variables used in the script:

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.
trans-unit.target: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.

trans-unit.source: Both the workflow file and the HiveQL file are stored in a blob container.
trans-unit.target: Both the workflow file and the HiveQL file are stored in a blob container.

trans-unit.source: The PowerShell script you will use later in this tutorial will copy both files to the default Storage account.
trans-unit.target: The PowerShell script you will use later in this tutorial will copy both files to the default Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Submit Oozie jobs using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Submit Oozie jobs using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight version 2.1).

trans-unit.source: The PowerShell script in this section performs the following steps:
trans-unit.target: The PowerShell script in this section performs the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager](../powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager](../powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL Database server, an Azure SQL database, and two tables.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL Database server, an Azure SQL database, and two tables.

trans-unit.source: These are used by the Sqoop action in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: These are used by the Sqoop action in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The table name is *log4jLogCount*.
trans-unit.target: The table name is *log4jLogCount*.

trans-unit.source: Create an HDInsight cluster used to run Oozie jobs.
trans-unit.target: Create an HDInsight cluster used to run Oozie jobs.

trans-unit.source: To examine the cluster, you can use the Azure portal or Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To examine the cluster, you can use the Azure portal or Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Copy the oozie workflow file and the HiveQL script file to the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Copy the oozie workflow file and the HiveQL script file to the default file system.

trans-unit.source: Both files are stored in a public Blob container.
trans-unit.target: Both files are stored in a public Blob container.

trans-unit.source: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Storage (wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql).
trans-unit.target: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Storage (wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql).

trans-unit.source: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.
trans-unit.target: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.

trans-unit.source: Submit an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: Submit an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: To examine the OOzie job results, use Visual Studio or other tools to connect to the Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: To examine the OOzie job results, use Visual Studio or other tools to connect to the Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Here is the script.
trans-unit.target: Here is the script.

trans-unit.source: You can run the script from Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can run the script from Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: You only need to configure the first 7 variables.
trans-unit.target: You only need to configure the first 7 variables.

trans-unit.source: **To re-run the tutorial**
trans-unit.target: **To re-run the tutorial**

trans-unit.source: To re-run the workflow, you must delete the following:
trans-unit.target: To re-run the workflow, you must delete the following:

trans-unit.source: The Hive script output file
trans-unit.target: The Hive script output file

trans-unit.source: The data in the log4jLogsCount table
trans-unit.target: The data in the log4jLogsCount table

trans-unit.target: Here is a sample PowerShell script that you can use:
